snippet: Researchers in New Orleans study animal droppings in zoos to find microbes capable of breaking down cellulose and converting it into biofuel.
abstract: Professor David A Mullin of Tulane University is studying animal droppings in zoos to find microbes capable of breaking down cellulose and converting it into biofuel; research is part of a widespread quest to develop an economically viable biofuel substitute for gasoline, which means producing it cheaply from common and unrefined materials.
lead_paragraph: Researchers in New Orleans study animal droppings in zoos to find microbes capable of breaking down cellulose and converting it into biofuel.

headline.seo: Tackling the Riddle of Putting a Zebra in Your Tank
headline.main: Finding a Way to Put a Zebra in Your Tank
headline.print_headline: Finding a Way To Put a Zebra In Your Tank
